articles.title: Letter to Kim Jong Il from Participants in 18th Conference of WFDY
articles.content:
Letter to Kim Jong Il from Participants in 18th Conference of WFDY

					Pyongyang, November 20 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received a letter on Nov. 12 from delegations and delegates of youth and students organizations of different countries to the 18th Conference of the World Federation of Democratic Youth.
					
					The conference marked an important occasion in powerfully demonstrating the will of the world progressive youth and students to resolutely shatter the imperialists' moves to check the people's cause of independence through international unity and solidarity and staunchly fight imperialism, not giving it up halfway, the letter said.
					
					It condemned the U.S. and other world reactionaries for their hostile policy toward the DPRK. We will continue waging the persistent solidarity movement of various forms in support of all the peace-loving efforts of the DPRK government, it stressed.
					
					We will extend positive support and encouragement to the Korean people and youth in their efforts to achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country and national prosperity under the banner of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration, it noted.
					
					It expressed the belief that the Korean people and youth would certainly realize the building of a thriving socialist nation and the cause of national reunification, united close around Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Korean Youth's Just Cause Backed at 18th Conference of WFDY
articles.content:
Korean Youth's Just Cause Backed at 18th Conference of WFDY

					Pyongyang, November 20 (KCNA) -- The 18th Conference of the World Federation of Democratic Youth expressed full support for the Korean people and youth in their efforts to build a thriving socialist nation and reunify the country independently and peacefully.
					
					The conference was held in Lisbon from Nov. 8 to 12. 
					
					The Declaration for International Solidarity adopted at the conference extended solidarity to the youth of the DPRK in a drive to achieve independent and peaceful reunification of the Korean Peninsula under the banner of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					
					It strongly demanded the immediate pullout of the U.S. troops and war hardware from south Korea--the main obstacle lying in the way of Korea's reunification--, establishment of lasting peace-keeping mechanism on the peninsula and the withdrawal of the south Korean authorities' confrontation policy towards the DPRK. 
					
					The Resolution on Asia-Pacific Region supported the peaceful reunification of the peninsula free from outside forces' interference. 
					
					It also called for grandly celebrating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung as a grand international political festival.
					
					The Political Declaration and resolutions on major themes were adopted at the conference. They accused the U.S. imperialists, the chieftain of the division of the Korean Peninsula, of making war provocations against the DPRK in collusion with its allies. 
					
					A letter to leader Kim Jong Il was adopted at the conference.

articles.title: President of Asian Olympic Council Arrives
articles.content:
President of Asian Olympic Council Arrives

					Pyongyang, November 20 (KCNA) -- Sheikh Ahmad Al Fahad Al Sabah, president of the Asian Olympic Council, and his party arrived here Sunday by a chartered plane. 
					
					They were greeted at the airport by Son Kwang Ho, vice-chairman of the DPRK Olympic Committee and vice-minister of Physical Culture and Sports, and Ho Jong, DPRK ambassador to Kuwait. 
					
					The DPRK Olympic Committee gave a reception in honor of the president and his party on the same day.
